intro: Melilotoides ruthenica var. liaosiensis, commonly known as the Liaosian melilot, is a flowering plant native to northern China. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry grasslands and open woodlands. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional herbal use.
